titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Walter Metzger American Association of University Professors Records of Academic Freedom and Tenure, 1888-2009 MS2369
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-11 11:54:32 -0500.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: The Walter Metzger American Association of University Professors Records of Academic Freedom and Tenure
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: This collection contains correspondence, articles, speeches, biographical data, and subject and research files. These materials represent the personal papers of Walter Metzger, the materials he created and collected as an Academic Freedom scholar and valued member of the American Association of University Professors. The materials date from 1888-2009.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into 6 series: History of American Association of University Professors, AAUP Academic Freedom and Tenure, Drafts and Published Materials, Higher Education and Professionalism, Correspondence, and Card Catalogues.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Walter P. Metzger (1922- 2016) was a historian and professor who led the American Association of University Professors towards better outlining and understanding the concept of Academic Freedom in higher education. After teaching and receiving his PhD from University of Iowa in 1950, he went on to continue his career at Columbia University in their history department, lecturing on 20th century U.S history. In 1955, Metzger co-authored the book "The Development of Academic Freedom in the United States" with Richard Hofstadter, which became the authoritative account of the history of academic freedom from colonial times until World War I. By the next year, in response to McCarthyism attack on academic freedom, General Secretary of the American Association of University Professors, Ralph F. Fuchs, invited Metzger to chair Committee H, a committee that centered on the History of the Association. Thus, a series of articles on AAUP history and the academic profession popularized the cultivation of academic freedom and tenure across the U.S. In 1958, he was appointed to Committee A, on Academic Freedom and Tenure, for which he continued his membership until retirement in 1985; yet, he still continued to act as a senior consultant until 2000. Within his 43 year tenure at Columbia University, he was the recipient of the 1990 Mark Van Doren Prize for teaching and was recognized as the official historian of AAUP, for which he dedicated his entire professional life to the organization with his contributions to Committee A on Academic Freedom and Tenure and his research on the history of higher education and academic freedom.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials within the collection provide us with Walter Metzgers research of the role and rights of tenured professors in higher education. This collection consists of AAUP policies, correspondence, case files, journal articles, newspaper clippings, academic publications, magazines, educational pamphlets, catalogue cards, notes, and committee minutes between 1820 and 2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The existing series were generated using folder titles provided by the donor under the assumption the content accurately reflects what is in the folder. Series 6 contains catalogue cards created by the donor that is an extention of the materials found within other series.

did.unittitle: History of American Association of University Professors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains research materials surrounding the founding of American Association of University Professors and how they developed during World War I, the 1920s and the Great Depression. These files are dated from 1910-1993.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series was organized into 3 subseries: Founding of AAUP, World War I, and the 20s and the Depression.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the initial cases, committees, membership logs, reports, and early files of the AAUP. These files are dated from 1913-1989.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged by subject.

On the Founding- Notes, Texts, Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains case files, AAUP policies, and research materials concerning the function of AAUP during World War I at various universities. These files are dated from 1910-1993.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains case files, AAUP policies, and research materials concerning the function of AAUP during World War I at various universities. These files are dated from 1917-1973.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains research materials concerning the development of Academic Freedom and Tenure, Academic Freedom and Tenure Cases, Committee papers and policies. These files are dated from 1888-2009.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series was organized into 3 subseries: Academic Freedom and Tenure, Academic Freedom Cases, and AAUP Committees and Committee Policies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains early case files, research, and publications concerning the growth of Academic Freedom and Tenure. These files are dated from 1913- 1989.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains AAUP and Committee A cases from various universities and subject matters concerning academic freedom in higher education within the United States. These files are dated from 1889-1999.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the papers of various committees and subcommittees within the American Association of University Professors and the policies they created for higher education institutions. These files are dated from 1922- 2009.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the drafts of published materials, reviews, speeches, and notes of Walter Metzger and his colleagues on Academic Freedom and Tenure. These files are dated from 1915- 2006.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is divided into 3 subseries: Published Articles and Books, Reviews and Public Speeches, and Drafts and Notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains published articles and bibliographies of Walter Metzger and his colleague's work on Academic Freedom and Tenure. The files are dated 1945-2006.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged by subject.

did.abstract: This series is arranged by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials that cover a range of topics within higher education and the standards of professionalism in higher learning institutions, both internationally and domestically. Materials cover the AAUP's perspective on Affirmative Action, accreditation, diversity, financial exigency, and profiles on institution types. The files are dated from 1939- 2007.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains catalogue cards created by Walter Metzger, which compiles notes of topics that can be found in within previous series. Each box contains a narrowed listing of catalogued topics titled by the donor. These boxes are dated between 1820-1970.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by subject.

did.unittitle: History of AAUP: Himstead and Fuchs and 1915- Himstead

odd.head: General
odd.p: History of AAUP Himstead and Fuchs includes: Himstead Pre GS, Himstead Election, Himstead and Cases 1936-1948, Himstead's GS-ship 1936-1948, Character- General, Interviews, Committee O, Himstead 1949-1955, Search for GS, Communist Policy 1947-1956, 1956 Report- Cases, 1956 Report, Fuchs, 1958

History of AAUP 1915- Himstead includes: History- Epochs, Depression Problems, War Problems, Democratizing Problems 1933-1935, Democratization 1936-1939, Complainants, Personality- Complainant, AAUP Relation To, Complainant Attitude Towards

did.unittitle: History of AAUP: 1915- Himstead and Founding of AAUP, and World War I

odd.head: General
odd.p: History of AAUP 1915- Himstead includes: Administrations, Institutions, Trustees, Deans and Department Heads, Presidents, AAUP Relations, Other Committees, Professional Ethics, Educational Quality, Pensions, Faculty Administrators, Appointment Service, Lobbying, Economic Status, Bulletin, External Relations, A.A.C, A.F.T., Accrediting Agencies, NEA and Secondary Schools, General, Leaders, Maguire, Cook
Founding of AAUP includes: Founding, Lovejoy, Tyler, Other Early Leaders, Organization, Chapters, Membership- Early, Membership Changes
World War I includes: World War One (General)

did.unittitle: World War I and the History of Tenure

odd.head: General
odd.p: World War I includes: Pacifism, German-Americans, Cattell Case, W.W.I. Cases, Willis Rudy, 1918

History of Tenure includes: Tenure- Colonial To 1913, Harvard, William and Mary, Tenure Systems 1820-1915, Presidential Response, Civil Service, School Teachers, The Ministry, Tenure-Contemporary, History of Tenure 1913-1940, Collective Bargaining, Legal Development, Financial Exigency, Tenure Abroad, 1915 Statement, 1914, 1915, 1940 Statement, What is 1940 Statement, Response for Revision

did.unittitle: History of Tenure, 1915, 1925, and 1940 Statements, and Committee A Procedure and Reports- Historical

odd.head: General
odd.p: History of Tenure, 1915, 1925, and 1940 Statements includes: History of Negotiations, Endorsements, Effects of 1940 Statement, Agreement in Writing, Ground for Dismissal, Freedom of Teaching, Freedom of Research, Extramural Freedom, Religious Exemption, Preamble, Academic Freedom- Who?, Termination and Non-Tenure, Probationary Period, Temporary or Part-time, 1970 Interpretations, Financial Exigency, Non-Retroactive Clause, 1956

Committee A Procedure and Reports includes: Committee A, Selection, Committee A- Early, Cases- Statistics, Committee A- Chairman, Internal Function A, Regional Division A, Washington Office A, Local Chapters A, Due Process, Waver, Discrimination, Resignation, Retirement, Anti- AAUP Reprisal, Investigating Cases, Investigators, Witnesses, Mediations, Reports, Report- Scope, Report- Type

did.unittitle: Committee A Procedure and Reports and Academic Freedom in Law and in U.S. Profession

odd.head: General
odd.p: Committee A Procedure and Reports includes: Report- Quality, Reports- Judgements, Report- Suppression, Report- Revision, Report- Rejoinder, Report- Review, Report- Libel, Cases, Cases- Speed, Cases- Censure, Cases- Redress, Prevention- Reform, Mediation, Arbitration, Boycotts, Role in Society

Academic Freedom in Law and in U.S. Profession includes: 2 Meanings of Academic Freedom, 1st Amendment History, Classroom Freedom, Extramural Freedom, Employee Gripe, Student Freedom, School Teachers, Search Freedom, Due Process, Discrimination, Religious Colleges, Judicial Analysis, Contracts, Financial Exigency, Judicial Remedies, Tenure and Academic Freedom, Confidentiality and Disclosure, Academics and the Law, Academic Freedom 1865-1915, Academic Freedom 1865-1920, Ross Case, 1900-1913

did.unittitle: Academic Freedom in Law and in U.S. Profession and British Universities

odd.head: General
odd.p: Academic Freedom in Law and in U.S. Profession includes: AAUP First Five, Utah, Montana, Colorado, Pennsylvania, Wesleyan, 1916-1917, Institutional Neutrality, Endowed Chairs, Student Freedom, Communism, Scientific Freedom

British Universities includes: For Annon Interview, Britain, Academic Profession, Britain- History of Universities, Britain- Historyof Academic Profession, Britain- Governance, Britiain- Funding of University Students, Halsey- Trow, Ideals and Values, Access, Teaching and Research, Public Sector, Conditions of Work, Britain- Expansion

did.unittitle: British Universities and Religion in Academe

odd.head: General
odd.p: British Universities includes: Britain- Thatcher Government, Britain- Academic Freedom, A.U.T Council, Education Reform Act
